intro: Sageretia ellipsoidea, commonly known as the elliptic sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Sageretia ellipsoidea is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
